meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be subdued or overcome.
meanings.sent1: She faced the challenge indomitably, refusing to give up.
meanings.sent2: He tackled the obstacle indomitably, showing great strength.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel indomitably tried to climb the tall tree, even though it kept slipping.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit soared indomitably, like a bird in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The flame burned indomitably, never flickering in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The soldier marched forward indomitably, ready to face any danger.
meanings.sent2: She pursued her dreams indomitably, never letting setbacks discourage her.
meanings.sent3: The kitten pounced on the toy indomitably, thinking it was a fierce opponent.
meanings.sent4: His willpower shone indomitably, like a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed indomitably, carving its path through the mountains.
